feedback.Physical object: Included — A tangible appliance commonly placed on kitchen counters or office stations.
feedback.Man-made / synthetic: Included — Fully designed and manufactured using human-made materials and components.
feedback.Biological or biologically-inspired: Excluded — No reference to biological systems or processes.
feedback.Fixed/static: Included — Typically remains in a fixed location while in use.
feedback.Structural: Included — Internal layout (water tank, heater, brew chamber) is essential to its operation.
feedback.Perceptible: Included — Features visible buttons, displays, and output of aroma, sound, and liquid.
feedback.Material form: Included — Constructed from durable plastics, metals, and glass.
feedback.Passive: Excluded — Performs active operations like heating and pumping during brewing.
feedback.Purposeful / intentional: Included — Designed specifically to produce brewed coffee.
feedback.Emits output / produces effect: Included — Delivers hot liquid (coffee) as functional output.
feedback.Processes or regulates logic/signals: Included — Controls temperature, brewing cycle, and possibly programmable settings.
feedback.Transforms or modifies internal state: Included — Water is heated and transformed into brewed coffee; internal components track brewing stage.
feedback.Interacts with humans directly: Included — Operated via buttons or touchscreen; gives feedback via light, sound, or display.
feedback.Part of a larger system: Excluded — Typically functions independently, not networked or integrative.
feedback.Autonomous in function: Included — Can complete brewing cycles without human intervention after start.
feedback.System-critical: Excluded — Not essential to any broader infrastructure.
feedback.Symbolic / representational: Excluded — Its outputs and states are functional, not representational.
feedback.Communicative: Excluded — Does not convey symbolic or coded information.
feedback.Logical / rule-based: Included — Brewing behavior follows defined internal logic and sequences.
feedback.Hierarchical / modular: Excluded — While componentized, it's not abstractly modular in behavior.
feedback.Behavior-guiding: Excluded — May support routine, but doesn’t semantically guide behavior.
feedback.Self-referential / meta-conceptual: Excluded — No awareness or representation of its own function.
feedback.Temporal: Included — Brewing involves time tracking (preheat, brew, delay-start).
feedback.Contextual abstraction: Excluded — Function remains consistent across contexts.
feedback.Socially / culturally constructed: Excluded — Common across many cultures without culturally determined semantics.
feedback.Defined by a group/system: Excluded — Not defined or classified by social systems.
feedback.Linked to identity or role: Excluded — No intrinsic link to social roles.
feedback.Regulated / governed: Excluded — May conform to standards, but not semantically governed.
feedback.Teachable / transmissible: Excluded — Can be taught to use, but not itself a teaching object.
feedback.Visible: Included — Displayed prominently; design aesthetics often emphasize visibility.
feedback.Context-sensitive: Excluded — Operates the same across environments.
feedback.Widely known: Included — Recognized globally in both domestic and commercial spaces.

encoding_notes: This encoding captures the coffee machine as a semi-autonomous, user-facing appliance with clearly structured physical and logical behavior. Its traits emphasize function, perceptibility, and ubiquity, while abstract and social characteristics remain minimal due to its utilitarian purpose.
